transcript.title: VISIT BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE ARGENTINE REPUBLIC H.E. DR CARLOS SAUL MENEM
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce that the President of the Argentine Republic,

Dr Carlos Saul Menem will visit Sydney and Canberra

from 29 March to 1 April. Dr Menem will be accompanied by senior

Argentine ministers and a large business delegation.

The visit is an excellent opportunity to build further the trade and

investment links between our countries. The business delegation accompanying

Dr Menem will include representatives from the transport, agriculture

and mining sectors.

Australia and Argentina are both strong commodities producers, with

fast developing manufacturing and services sectors. Argentine industries

are increasingly turning to the Asia-Pacific for new markets and Australian

companies are being drawn by opportunities in South America.

Australia and Argentina share similar perspectives on a range of international

issues, including our mutual interest in liberalising agricultural

trade.

I look forward to my discussions with Dr Menem, with a view to deepening

the relationship between our countries.
